title: The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society (LLS) to Host Inaugural Perkins Corporate Challenge

SOURCE Leukemia & Lymphoma Society - Greater San Francisco Bay Area Chapter
Corporations Partner with LLS to Sail to Find a Cure for Blood Cancers
SAN FRANCISCO , Oct. 6, 2015 /PRNewswire-USNewswire/ -- As part of the 10 th Annual Bay Area Leukemia Cup Regatta, The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society's (LLS) Greater Bay Area Chapter will be hosting its inaugural Perkins Corporate Challenge on October 17, 2015 at The St. Francis Yacht Club in San Francisco . Accel, Kilroy Realty, Pacific Union International and Visa have each committed teams to compete for the Perkins Challenge Trophy, which will be presented at the Leukemia Cup Regatta VIP Dinner later that night. The Perkins Corporate Challenge is an opportunity for Northern California businesses to help LLS invest important funds for breakthrough research and provide access to life-saving treatments for blood cancer patients.
"We are honored to have these leading Bay Area companies join us for the inaugural Perkins Corporate Challenge," said Matt Cromar , Perkins Corporate Challenge Committee Chair. "They are not only leaders in their industries but also in their philanthropic endeavors. With their participation and support, LLS is able to fund critical research efforts and provide assistance to local families affected by a blood cancer diagnosis. We look forward to seeing them compete on the water in what will become a cornerstone event for the Leukemia Cup Regatta."
During the Perkins Corporate Challenge, five corporate teams will race on J/22 class sailboats provided by the St. Francis Yacht Club. Teams from Accel, Kilroy Realty, Pacific Union International and Visa will compete for the Perkins Challenge Trophy while joining forces to support the LLS mission. In order to compete, each company committed at least $20,000 per team to LLS and will be attending the VIP Dinner. The Perkins Corporate Challenge is named after and celebrates Thomas Perkins , Leukemia Cup Regatta Honorary Chairman and founder of Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers. Perkins has played a pivotal role in the Bay Area Leukemia Cup Regatta since its inception 10 years ago.
The Leukemia Cup Regatta is a thrilling sailing event that combines the joy of boating with the important task of raising money to cure cancer. The 10 th Annual Bay Area Leukemia Cup Regatta will be taking place on October 17-18, 2015 at The San Francisco Yacht Club in Belvedere, Calif. The VIP Dinner will take place on October 17 with special guest speaker Joe Lacob , owner, co-executive chairman, CEO and governor of the Golden State Warriors, co-managing member of the Golden State Warriors' ownership group and strategic advisor to Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers. Since 2006, the Bay Area Leukemia Cup Regatta has raised over $5.1 million to support LLS's mission to find a cure for blood cancers and improve the quality of life for patients and their families.
For questions, contact Jennifer Daly at 415-625-1139 or Jennifer.Daly@lls.org . For more information on the Leukemia Cup Regatta, visit www.leukemiacup.org/gba .
About The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society
The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society ® (LLS) is the world's largest voluntary health agency dedicated to blood cancer. The LLS mission: Cure leukemia, lymphoma, Hodgkin's disease and myeloma, and improve the quality of life of patients and their families. LLS funds lifesaving blood cancer research around the world and provides free information and support services for patients and their loved ones.
Major LLS fundraising campaigns include Team In Training, Light The Night Walk, School & Youth, Man & Woman of the Year and Leukemia Cup Regatta. To reach the widest possible audience, LLS partners with national and regional level companies and brands, including Nike, Disney, Burlington and others.
Founded in 1949 and headquartered in White Plains, NY , LLS has chapters throughout the United States and Canada . To learn more, visit www.LLS.org . Patients and caregivers should contact the Information Resource Center at (800) 955-4572, Monday through Friday, 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. ET .
